meanings.definition: The outermost layer of the skin.
meanings.sent1: The epidermis protects our body from harmful elements.
meanings.sent2: She applied sunscreen to her epidermis before going to the beach.
meanings.sent3: The epidermis felt like a shield against the sun's rays.
meanings.sent4: Her epidermis was a barrier, keeping her safe from the outside world.
meanings.sent5: The epidermis, like a sturdy wall, shielded her delicate inner layers.

meanings.definition: A thin protective layer covering the surface of plants.
meanings.sent1: The epidermis of the leaf helps prevent water loss.
meanings.sent2: The gardener noticed damage to the plant's epidermis.
meanings.sent3: The epidermis of the plant seemed to be blushing in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The epidermis of the plant was like a coat of armor against pests.
meanings.sent5: The epidermis, like a transparent shield, guarded the plant's inner workings.
